alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 8:23PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Weber...northeastern Davis and west central Morgan Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 822 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Syracuse, or near Hill Air Force Base, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Layton, Farmington, Morgan, Hill Air Force Base, Roy, Clearfield, Kaysville, Syracuse, Clinton, South Ogden, Washington Terrace, Riverdale, Hooper, South Weber, Uintah, Weber State University, West Haven, West Point and Sunset. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 324 and 342. Interstate 84 between mile markers 82 and 106. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
